title: rust-gdb can't show string/&str variables

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
(gdb) p host
Python Exception <type 'exceptions.TypeError'> Could not convert Python object: <gdb.Field object at 0x7f09e53ed1e0>.: 
$1 = 
(gdb) p host_v6
Python Exception <type 'exceptions.TypeError'> Could not convert Python object: <gdb.Field object at 0x7f09e53ed1b0>.: 
$2 = 
(gdb) p a
$3 = 95
(gdb)



set python print-stack full

then:
(gdb) p host
$1 = Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/rustlib/etc/gdb_rust_pretty_printing.py", line 265, in to_string
    (length, data_ptr) = rustpp.extract_length_and_ptr_from_slice(self.__val)
  File "/usr/local/lib/rustlib/etc/debugger_pretty_printers_common.py", line 373, in extract_length_and_ptr_from_slice
    length = slice_val.get_child_at_index(length_field_index).as_integer()
  File "/usr/local/lib/rustlib/etc/gdb_rust_pretty_printing.py", line 77, in get_child_at_index
    child = GdbValue(self.gdb_val[gdb_field])
TypeError: Could not convert Python object: <gdb.Field object at 0x7fcc3cfaf1e0>.

(gdb)


demo code:

```rust
fn main() {
    let a = 100 - 10 / 2;
    info!("result:{}", a);

    let host = "[3e80:a178:b18f:c5dd:250:56ff:fe9d:a351]";
    let host_v6 = host.replace('[', "").replace(']', "");
}
```
